original: PETERSON, E G, Köpman, Örebro, f i Värml 26/3 92. Eft slut skolgång anst Luleå. Inneh fma E G Petersons Tobaks- o Pappers-hdl (gr!4) o fma Centrala Tobaksaff (gr 40) öbr. Ordf öbr tobakshandl.frn, v. sekr frn öbr köpmän, styr.suppl öbr köpm.frb.
translated: PETERSON, E G, Merchant, Örebro, b. in Värmland on March 26th, 1892. After completing his schooling, he worked in Luleå. He owned the company E G Peterson's Tobacco and Paper Trade (est. 1914) and was the owner of Central Tobacco Shop (est. 1940) in Örebro. He served as chairman of the local tobacconist association and was vice secretary for the local merchants' association board. He was also a deputy member of the local merchants' federation.
